InteractionDesign.Group3

Class WeatherData

  • java.lang.Object
    • InteractionDesign.Group3.WeatherData

  • public class WeatherData
extends java.lang.Object
    A cache of the most recently loaded weather data. This acts as an interface between the frontend and the API. The cache is saved to disk, so that is can be reloaded later. This is a singleton. When instantiated, the cache is loaded from disk if a cache file already exists.

                                     throws CacheException
        Returns the singleton instance of WeatherData.
        Returns:
        the singleton
        Throws:
        CacheException - if the cache file fails to load (which may be because the cache file does not yet exist)

        fin - the second time stamp

      • getThisWeek

        public java.util.Map<java.time.DayOfWeek,java.util.List<Record>> getThisWeek()
        Gets the weekly forecast. This is a map of week day to forecast. To get the correct order, this should be compared to the current day of the week.
        Returns:
        the forecast for each day of the week

      • getToday

        public java.util.List<Record> getToday()
        Gets the forecast for today. Each record gives weather data for a particular time, as well as a time stamp. Watch out for daily forecast not referring to today, if the cache is out of date (check time stamps)
        Returns:
        daily weather forecast

      • getWarnings

        public java.util.List<Warning> getWarnings()
        Gets any weather warnings.
        Returns:
        list of warnings

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
             throws APIException,
                    CacheException
        Accesses the API and updates the cache. The latest weather forecast is downloaded. If no exception is thrown, the latest data can be accessed through getters. The latest forecast is also saved to file, so that it can be loaded if the app is restarted.
        Throws:
        APIException - if downloading weather forecast fails
        CacheException - if saving to disk fails

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(java.lang.String l)
                 throws CacheException
        Updates the location and saves to disk. Note that this is only a string, and not currently validated. We should look at validating it with the API.
        Parameters:
        l - location string
        Throws:
        CacheException - if saving to disk fails
